description.fr: Ce module complémentaire ne sera plus pris en charge lorsque Thunderbird 78 sortira d'ici quelques mois, à moins qu'un nombre suffisant de personnes s'engage pour soutenir la poursuite de la maintenance du module et la rende possible. Pour montrer votre soutien, rendez-vous sur la page https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jik/rewritten-add-ons-for-mozilla-thunderbirds-next-release et contribuez. En bonus, les contributeurs Kickstarter de ce module et de mes autres modules complémentaires bénéficieront de ristournes significatives sur les licences des modules complémentaires. Enable the View | Message Body As | All Body Parts message display mode, which causes all parts of the message, even those that normally would not be displayed, to be visible in the message viewing area (if Thunderbird knows how to display them) and listed in the attachments pane. You might need this if someone sends you a message with a “hidden” attachment, i.e., a message whose structure is malformatted such that Thunderbird is “correct” not to display it, but you still need to get access to it. You might also need this if you want to be able to remove inline images from messages. Inline images normally are not displayed in the attachments pane, but the All Body Parts message display mode makes them visible.
description.en-US: This add-on will no longer be supported when Thunderbird 78 is released in a few months, unless enough people commit to supporting continued maintenance of the add-on to make it feasible. To show your commitment, please visit https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jik/rewritten-add-ons-for-mozilla-thunderbirds-next-release and make a pledge. As a bonus, Kickstarter supporters of this and my other add-ons will receive significant discounts on add-on licenses. Enable the View | Message Body As | All Body Parts message display mode, which causes all parts of the message, even those that normally would not be displayed, to be visible in the message viewing area (if Thunderbird knows how to display them) and listed in the attachments pane. You might need this if someone sends you a message with a “hidden” attachment, i.e., a message whose structure is malformatted such that Thunderbird is “correct” not to display it, but you still need to get access to it. You might also need this if you want to be able to remove inline images from messages. Inline images normally are not displayed in the attachments pane, but the All Body Parts message display mode makes them visible.
